revised_title: Anatomy and Function of Nerve Roots in the Brachial Plexus of the Dog
tldr: The author conducted experiments on dogs to study the nerve roots and their functions in the brachial plexus. They found that each nerve root sends fibers to multiple nerves and muscles, and that the order of derivation from above down is constant. The sensory nerves also follow specific rules in their distribution. This research helped to better understand the complex relationships between nerve roots, nerves, and muscles.
